description:
<p>Nursing Assistant – Hospice at Home<br />Full and Part time roles available<br /><br />Is it time for your next step?<br /><br />South Oxfordshire Palliative Care Hub has now relocated to Crowmarsh, Wallingford. Hospice at Home provides end of life care in patients homes in South Oxfordshire.<br /><br />We are pleased to invite applications on a permanent basis to become part of our team as we move forward providing an indispensable service.<br /><br />The team cover South Oxfordshire, including Abingdon, Didcot, Henley, Wantage, Wallingford & in the Vale of the White Horse.</p>
<p>If you don't have experience but feel you may have transferable skills we would like to hear from you. This role requires excellent communication skills and training for the delivery of care can be provided to the right person.<br /><br />This a wonderful opportunity to develop your skills as a Nursing Assistant in the specialist field of palliative care.<br /><br />You will be paid for the whole shift regardless of the how many visits are undertaken.<br /><br />*Competitive employee benefits*<br /><br />• £18,166 to £19,339 pro-rata, per annum (£9.29 - £9.89 per hour) (depending upon experience)<br />• Company pension scheme<br />• 25 days holiday - rising to 30 with length of service plus bank holidays<br />• Enhanced maternity and paternity pay<br />• Enhanced sick pay<br />• Competitive enhanced pay for nights, weekends and public holidays<br />• Mileage allowance 45p pence per mile<br />• Continuation of NHS pension<br />• Corporate discount with hundreds of retailers and services<br />• Staff discount of 15% on new goods online at shop.sueryder.org<br />• Cash referral bonus scheme<br />• Salary sacrifice car scheme<br />• Online Wellbeing Centre<br />• Free Will writing service<br />• Staff finance loans<br />• Free onsite parking<br />• Free uniform<br />• Carers leave policy<br />• Structured induction programme and learning and development opportunities<br />To join us as a Nursing Assistant NVQ level 2 is desirable or be willing to work towards.<br /><br />A full UK driving license (manual & automatic) with insurance cover that allows business use is also required. A lease car provided for work visits, covering South Oxfordshire.<br /><br />Other organisations may call this role Care Assistant, Healthcare Assistant, Trainee Care Worker, Health & Social Care Worker, Social Care Worker, or Carer.<br /><br />Employment subject to a satisfactory DBS check.<br /><br />Sue Ryder supports people through the most difficult times of their lives. Whether that’s a terminal illness, the loss of a loved one or a neurological condition – we’re there when it matters. Our doctors, nurses and carers give people the compassion and expert care they need to help them live the best life they possibly can.</p>
title: Nursing Assistant - Community Palliative Care
